result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Intern Julian Marrufo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Annette E Rauch in court for Steven P Berby.  
Defendant Steven P Berby appeared by video in custody at Racine Correctional.
Attorney Rauch request another hearing date.  Court grants.
Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Current: PO Box 900, c/o Racine Correctional Institution, Sturtevant, WI 53177-0900 United States  (Effective: 09-30-2022)
Prior: 234 W Main St,#501, Waukesha, WI 53186
Hearing on October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 8:55 AM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Steven P Berby in court, in custody by zoom from DCI, with attorney Annette E Rauch.   
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Rauch indicates that if a speedy trial demand was made, it is withdrawn.  Court did not see that in the record.
Attorney Rauch requests another hearing date.  Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

**sent via email on 06-03-2022 (mjs)

records.addlTxt: Hearing on May 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

08:41 AM Defendant Steven P Berby in court, in custody, with attorney Annette E Rauch.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
DDA Boese states that the offer given to the Defendant contemplated waiving prelim; offer is now revoked. 
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Nicholas Hendriksen, of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by DDA Thruston.
Cross examination by attorney Rauch.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.

08:15 AM Defendant Steven P Berby in court, in custody, with attorney Annette E Rauch.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests an adjournment.  Atty. Rauch agrees.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Court adjourns.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.
